doc.field: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 25
Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 25
COMMERCIAL: Thirteenth Annual Center Garden Party

1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community. Includes NY1 footage of NYC Mayor Rudy Giuliani saying "Marriage should remain the way it is." Also includes footage of Christopher Lynn, Taxi and Limousine Commissioner, defending Rudy Giuliani.
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, "The one. The only. The original."

2. Footage of "The Great Wed-In" at Bryant Park. Includes footage of Tom Duane, NYC Council Member; Gloria Steinem, activist; William Wynkoop and Roy Strickland; Connie and Dorothy Danaher; and Tori Watson and Scott Blankenship.
3. Footage of Karen Burstein, Candidate for Manhattan Surrogate Court Judge, at "The Great Wed-In".
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, National Alliance for Research on Schizophrenia and Depression

5. "Lambda Update": Kevin Cathcart, Executive Director of the Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund, introduces Lou Maletta's interview with Beatrice Dohrn, Lambda Legal Director, regarding recent cases concerning harassment of women's health clinics and abortion access.

6. Footage of Gay Pride Month celebration at City Hall. Includes footage of Alan Hevesi, Comptroller of NYC; Daniell Dromm, award recipient, Founder of the Queens Lesbian and Gay Pride Committee, openly gay teacher for District 24; Angie Iglesia Martell, award recipient, Board Member of the Community Center, Vice President of the Lesbian and Gay Law Association; Phil Reed, award recipient, political leader for the Upper West Side of NYC, activist for AIDS education and health; Lisa Winters, award recipient, Founder of Bronx Lesbians United in Sisterhood (BLUES), Program Coordinator for Bronx Lebanon Hospital; and Wayne Steinman, award recipient, Creator of the Comptroller's Lesbian and Gay Directory, Co-Founder of Center Kids.
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, "The one. The only. The original."
7. Footage of Ann Northrop at Grand Central Terminal interviewing [Eric Karpeles, artist], regarding his exhibition "The Sanctuary Project".
COMMERCIAL: Thirteenth Annual Center Garden Party
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, "Be a teacher. Be a hero."
9. Interview: Christine Quinn, Executive Director of the Anti-Violence Project, discusses the recent murder of two lesbians.
10. Lou Maletta urges viewers to pledge money to Gay Cable Network.
